campaign.story:
The latest addition to our range takes all the strength, quality and craftsmanship you’d expect from a WESN blade - and packs it into our most compact, lightweight knife to date. The Samla is inspired by our Scandinavian heritage and steeped in our love for the wilderness.
Northern Scandinavia is no place for a normal knife. Without a reliable blade to hand, it can be a remote wilderness, reluctant to yield its resources. But with the right blade — durable steel; an unrelenting edge — an abundance of wild game, fish and forage reveal itself. It takes a special blade to unlock the wilderness and make it home.
Our Samla knife is inspired by our passion for the wilderness.  Before our blade was forged in steel, it was conceived in the blueberry groves of Michigan that I explored as a kid and the mountain tops of the Swedish wildness I later discovered as an adult.
We returned to this time to reimagine what a trail knife should be. It’s why our latest WESN knife is extremely light and compact when carried, but versatile enough for food prep or precision cutting around camp. It’s the knife that won’t let you down when you venture to the edge.

The Samla knife is our latest design evolution of what an everyday carry should be. We started out with the sleek and practical Microblade, then scaled up to bigger tasks with the Allman. With the Henry pocket knife, we honored heritage. Each new design in the range is an extension not just of our pride, but of your capability in the outdoors.

Light as a Feather
Even casual day-explorers know that weight matters. For a hiker’s knife, we knew we needed to make it compact and light as a feather, without compromising on toughness or durability. The titanium or wood scale handle measures a snug 3.25” in length, and just 0.25” in thickness. But this is a knife that punches well above its size - just 5.7” from foot to tip when fully open, but that’s steel enough to unlock the wilderness.
With Your Meals in Mind
Carry the only knife you need in your cook kit. The sharp, precise steel blade measures 2.45” and slices easily through prep work. It’s tough and versatile enough to cope with everyday repair tasks around camp, from slicing rope to cutting canvas. 
The Trademark WESN Durability
Outstanding corrosion resistance means you can draw a bright, keen blade every time with minimal maintenance. We’ve treated each component with care and attention in our design: From the non-locking friction folder for a smooth, steady action to the phosphor bronze washers for long-lasting, corrosion-resistant performance.
The Samla Sheath
We are excited to introduce the Samla Leather Sleeve. Hand made in Sweden, with natural vegetable tanned leather, the sleeve will age in time, showing character unique to how you use it. Both sleek and practical, the sleeve is the perfect companion for the Samla.



Get Your Project Funded Today!
In collaboration with BackersOnly, an exclusive crowdfunding agency for high profile creators. We've helped 500+ projects raise over $45MM.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We have a dedicated team focused on production. Since our first launch, we’ve fulfilled over 30,000 orders. From our experience we’ve learned there can always be bumps in the road. We promise to handle and solve each challenge in order to hit production deadlines. We have a strategic plan to hit those deadlines, however, due to unforeseen issues, there is always a small risk of delay in delivery.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Long-lasting design
With our products focused on being instant classics, nothing about our designs are trendy or cater to hype trains. The knife you carry today will still suit your grandchild perfectly when they use it. We insist on crafting our knives at the intersection of quality and beauty — ensuring your WESN knife suits any and every occasion.
Reusability and recyclability
Our packaging is made from post-consumer materials and 100% biodegradable. Although it’s cheaper to go with plastic pull tabs and bubble wrap instead of leather pull tabs and wood shavings, we followed our convictions and went the “greener” route. With our plastic-free packaging, you can toss it away and feel good about doing mother earth a solid.
Sustainable materials
There are many design trends when it comes to knives. The worst we’ve seen in recent times is using low-quality materials, at the cost of a quick buck. Through many hours of R & D, we’re very pleased with our material choice and functional design. As long as your friends don’t steal it, you’ll proudly own the Samla for a lifetime.

Risks and challenges
OBSBOT Me is our second Kickstarter campaign, after our first campaign we delivered over 5,000 units of our product to our customers across the world. Along the way, we built up tools, expertise, relationships, and experience that will help us to deliver OBSBOT Me to our backers. 

From a technology standpoint, much of the work that went into OBSBOT Tiny can be reused as a foundation for OBSBOT Me. Having that foundation means we can spend more time optimizing performance and testing features.

However, we understand there might still be some unexpected challenges in a well-prepared crowdfunding campaign, so we will make sure to send out updates whenever there is a slight change or issue. 

Please be aware that there may be extra customs fees due to the policy of different countries, and you will be responsible for customs fees, duties, VAT, import taxes, etc. administered by your government. They are excluded from the shipping fees. Normally, you won't be charged import duty taxes. However, given many different regulations in different countries, we can't guarantee that 100%. campaign.story:
LARGE #6 NIB AND WIDE COMFY GRIP
Our new PIUMA pocket fountain pen is very compact but grows into a full-size pen when posted. It also features a large #6 nib (very rare for pocket pens) and a wide grip section for a very comfortable writing experience.
Top: brass, middle: black aluminum, bottom: titanium
SOLID MATERIALS
We are offering our PIUMA pen in titanium, brass, and black aluminum. All pens are CNC-milled from solid metal bars with the latest manufacturing equipment. We use 6061-T6 aluminum which is usually reserved for the aerospace industry. Our brass is free of lead and we use grade 5 titanium.
PIUMA Pocket Titanium
PIUMA Pocket Black Aluminum
PIUMA Pocket Brass
NIBS
The pens come equipped with German-made steel nibs (Peter Bock). Titanium and brass pens come with a polished steel nib, while black aluminum pens come with a black lacquered steel nib. Backers can also upgrade their nibs to a titanium nib ($40 extra cost). Titanium nibs and steel nibs provide the same smooth writing experience but titanium nibs are more flexible which allows for line variation when applying pressure while writing.
At the end of the campaign, backers will receive a survey where they will be able to select their desired nib size. We are offering EF, F, M, and B nib sizes.
Top: titanium nib (extra cost), bottom: polished steel (standard)
Nib sizes
INK
The PIUMA pocket fountain pen accepts all standard international ink cartridges which are widely available worldwide. All pens will include one black ink cartridge. In addition, you can also use a bulb (aerometric) converter (not included). 
SPECS
Length (closed): 92mm / 3.6"
Length posted (including nib): 140mm / 5.5"
Maximum width: 15mm / 0.59"
Average grip width: 12mm / 0.47"
Black aluminum weight: 24g / 0.85oz
Brass weight: 67g / 2.36oz
Titanium weight: 38g / 1.34oz
PIUMA Pocket Titanium
PIUMA Pocket Black Aluminum
PIUMA Pocket Brass
Top: brass, middle: black aluminum, bottom: titanium
Size comparison. Top: Kaweco Liliput, Middle: LAMY Safari, Bottom: Fisher Space Pen

updates.update_content:
Dear Backers,
We hope you are doing well. 
The production of the pens is going very well and we are almost done with machining and finishing Packaging is also complete and we are just waiting for the Bock nibs to arrive from Germany. Nibs have been delayed a few weeks and will arrive during the week of July 12th. Soon after, we will assemble and test all pens. We expect to commence shipping on July 19th, which is a couple of weeks behind our schedule. We apologize for the delay and will work hard to ship the pens fast.

Dear Backers,
We hope you are doing well.
Only 70% of the backers have completed their survey. It is very important that the missing 30% answer the survey within the next few days. We need to know how many pens we are making in each material and which nibs to order from our supplier. 
If you have not received your survey, please check your spam folder. 
Thank you!

Dear Backers,
We hope you are doing well.
During the next 2 days, you will receive an email from BACKERKIT with a link to your survey. Most of the emails will land in your inboxes, but a few can end up in the spam folders. If you have not received your survey by Friday, May 14, please check your spam folder.

Dear Backers,
We are thrilled with the results of the Kickstarter campaign and would like to thank each of you for your support. 
During the next few days, Kickstarter will charge credit cards and verify pledges. Please make sure that you have your credit card details up to date. In two weeks, we will receive the final backers' list and we will be able to send a survey via Backerkit. Within this survey, you will be able to select your desired pens, nib sizes and upgrade to a titanium nib. We will also offer leather sleeves and potentially the bulb ink converter (we are in communication with the supplier).

campaign.story:
Earlier this year, our Original Sketchmark raised over 1700% of our initial goal on Kickstarter as "The bookmark stencil for everyone." Now, we're back with the newest addition to the Sketchmark family!
The Original Sketchmark was designed for journalers, designers, architects and artists alike. After receiving input from our backers, we created an expansion card with a focus on bullet journalers. 
Our new design features 3 journal specific tools to take your bullet journaling up a notch. Use the BUJO Expansion Card by itself or combine it with the Original Sketchmark for even more creative possibilities!
After packing the Original Sketchmark with over 15 features, we designed the Bullet Journal Expansion Card to complement it, not replace it! We built a card with 3 bullet journal specific features that fit into a small, compact design. Paired with the features of the Original Sketchmark, the possibilities for your journaling are endless!
The alphabet stencils were carefully designed to make it easy for you to add titles, dates, and more to your bullet journal! Our unique punctuation stencil allows you to easily create question marks, exclamation points, and periods. The stencils are designed to fit within two vertical rows of a 5mm x 5mm grid journal.
Use the monthly tracker to keep track of all your habits! Track everything from your workouts, eating habits, sleep schedule, spending, and much more! Our unique design gives you plenty of versatility in creating your own trackers. Use the card as a stencil to create boxes for each day or use the card as a guide to quickly number your days in perfectly spaced 5mm x 5mm boxes. Unlike most stencils, we included 2 title boxes for more options! You can create amazing titles featuring letters and symbols when you use the alignment guides above the title boxes!
Title alignment points make it easy to add icons and titles above your calendars. When drawing a title box, simply stop at one of the 3 marking points to include a 1, 2, or 3 letter title.
For example, to add "JUN" to represent JUNE on your calendar, stop tracing at the alignment point with 3 dots to have the perfect spacing to fit your 3 letter title. 
A single icon fits perfectly when you stop at the alignment point with a single dot above it.
Add some character to your bullet journal with our 10 journal icons! We included 7 basic icons that can be used to represent anything you want! We also included 3 journaling specific icons that can take on a few different meanings of their own. Each icon is designed to fit within a 10mm x 10mm box.
Just like the Original, the Sketchmark Expansion Card doubles as a bookmark! Sketchmark’s bookmark cutout keeps your Sketchmark close to your journal at all times. Use it to mark your page in your journal, textbook, or book! 
Sketchmark isn't just for journaling. Use it as your primary bookmark to quickly underline key passages or use the journal icons to take notes and star, check or otherwise mark your book or textbook!

Pair the Sketchmark BUJO Expansion Card with the Original Sketchmark! Launched in January, our original card has over 15 tools for journaling, designing and sketching. After raising over 1700% of our initial goal, input from our Original Sketchmark customers helped us bring the BUJO Expansion Card to life! 
We designed the BUJO Expansion card to complement the Original Sketchmark, not replace it! The features of both cards are designed to work together to give you endless possibilities in creating your journal. Watch our first Kickstarter video below to see all of the Original Sketchmark's features!
 Add-ons will be available following the campaign through Backerkit!
Sketchmark's possibilities are endless! Check out a few samples of what is possible with Sketchmark and the Bullet Journal Expansion Card below! 
Get inspired by other bullet journalers by following popular hashtags on social media! #BUJO,  #bulletjournal, #bulletjournaling

campaign.story:
In 2017 we launched our first Kickstarter, Hippo Noto.  It was our dream to develop a notebook that was "hippo sized" and could hold many memories/thoughts/ideas in one place.  500 pages of 68GSM Tomoe River Paper strong, with the help of 1401 original backers and many Late Pledges, that project came to life in a big way.
The original project as well as this one are dedicated to our son who left this world too soon. He will always be our little Hippo in the sky <3
The #hipposquad originally planned to launch the B6 Pygmy Hippo Noto first, but since the original campaign people have been asking for a full sized A5.  We sent out a survey to feel out interest, and now heed the call for a dual launch!  This project is our most ambitious yet, with more collaborations, multiple sizes, and added features.
Front: B6 Pygmy Hippo Noto, Back: A5 Standard Hippo Noto
The Pygmy Hippo and new A5 Standard Hippo Noto, pack all of the features loved from the original Pocket A5 Hippo Noto and also add a few new twists.
Original Features:
Back Pocket:  For all your swabs, mini notebooks, stencils and more!
Elastic Closure:  To keep your Hippo secure.
Two Bookmarks:  Convenience in the form of ribbons.
68GSM Ivory Tomoe River Paper:  All the things you love about 52GSM but with less ghosting, and a more robust feel.
Whats New:
Page Numbers!:  One of the most requested features our backers from the last Kickstarter had.
Colored Dots:  Each Pygmy and A5 Standard Hippo Noto have interior dot grid that match the elastic band closure of the book itself.  To add a bit of pop to your writing experience.
Tons of Pages!:  The Pygmy Hippo Noto boasts 400 pages, while the A5 Standard keeps the 500 page count that the original has.
Cloth Reinforced Thread Binding:  The original Hippo Noto was thread bound, and this time we are making the binding even stronger by adding a piece of cloth to the profile.
Cover texture:  Some of our cover options will be textured!
New cloth reinforced binding.
We are so blessed to have the talented Robert Oster do a brand new ink color exclusively for this Kickstarter.  It is lovingly named Pygmy Purple.
It is a berry magenta that has excellent shading and sheen, especially on the 68GSM Tomoe River Paper of Hippo Noto.
Up close and personal with Robert Oster Pygmy Purple
Lets Talk Specs!
A5 Standard Hippo Noto: 
Measures 148 x 210 mm
68GSM Ivory Tomoe River Paper (the TR paper tone closest to white and the most popular option from our last campaign)
Page Count:  500 Hippo Numbered Pages
Back Pocket
Elastic Band Closure
Dot Grid Interior Printing That Playfully Matches Color of Elastic Band (additional rulings as stretch goals).
Cloth Reinforced Thread Binding
Attractive and Durable Covers
B6 Pygmy Hippo Noto:
Measures 125 x 176 mm
68GSM Ivory Tomoe River Paper (the TR paper tone closest to white and the most popular option from our last campaign)
Page Count:  400 Hippo Numbered Pages
Back Pocket
Elastic Band Closure
Dot Grid Interior Printing That Playfully Matches Color of Elastic Band (additional rulings as stretch goals).
Cloth Reinforced Thread Binding
Attractive and Durable Covers
The Colors! 
This Kickstarter will start off with two colors, one in A5 Standard and one in Pygmy B6.  We will add more colors as stretch goals, some of which the backers will choose!  We wanted to make this Kickstarter more interactive, as we had such a great response letting the backers choose the stretch goal color for the last campaign.
A5 Standard:  So Black.  This Hippo will feature a black cover, grey interior end pages, grey interior dot grid printing/page numbers, black bookmarks, and black elastic band closure.  The Hippo Noto logo on the front will feature a dark grey foil, in contrast to the traditional silver we use on all our other models.
B6 Pygmy:  Purple.  Hippos are purple after all!  This Hippo Noto will feature a royal purple cover with purple interior end pages, two purple bookmarks (light and dark), fanciful purple interior printing dot grid/page numbers, and a light purple elastic band closure.
Purple B6 Pygmy Hippo Noto Prototype
Interior dot grid that matches the elastic bands! ***In the So Black Hippo Noto, the dots will be a grey as to not be tooo distracting.
The Paper
At the core of Hippo Noto is the paper that we use, 68GSM Tomoe River Paper.  This paper is optimal for fountain pens and amazing at bringing out the magic in ink that might otherwise be flat.  This special paper is imported from Japan.  Here are some examples of shading and sheen on 68GSM Hippo Noto TR Paper.
PLAY

The Extras
 Robert Oster Pygmy Purple Ink:  Add $17 to any package to add a bottle of ink to your pledge.
 Rickshaw Bags 6 Pen Sleeve!  A 6 pen sleeve that features an ink blob of Robert Oster Pygmy Purple.  This sleeve has luxurious padding and provides optimal protection for your pens while matching your new ink perfectly.  Add $49 to any package to receive one with your pledge.
Extra A5 Standard Hippo Noto:  Add an A5 standard Hippo Noto to any reward tier by adding $37 to your pledge.
Extra B6 Pygmy Hippo Noto:  Add a B6 Pygmy Hippo Noto to any reward tier by adding $27 to your pledge.
 Herbert Pen Company Pen:  Details upcoming!  This will be a limited release.
Stretch Goals!
$35,000 Initial goal reached!
$45,000 A5 Grey/Turquoise and B6 Grey/Magenta added as color options
$50,000 Free Writing Mat
$60,000 New B6 Color added, the people will choose the color by vote!
$65,000 Lined as an option
$70,000 New A5 Color to be added and chosen by the people!
$75,000 Free Hippo Noto Mini Book
$80,000 Blank as an option
Thank you for considering backing our project <3
Want a Hippo Noto to enjoy while you wait for the Pygmy Invasion to arrive?  Visit our shop, where you can adopt one of our original Pocket A5 Hippo Noto Notebooks.  The Hippo that started it all.

Friends and followers,
We're excited to announce the arrival of our latest model in the Field Pen Line: The Twist. It's our first design to incorporate Parker size refills. The fully machined body is integrated with tactile details, smooth 'lock in' action, and an effortless gel writer from Itoya.  
See our full catalog here: machine-era.com



Quality Components
Ink:  After running through many different Parker size ink cartridges, we've settled on the Itoya Aquaroller as the best choice for this writing tool. The 0.7mm acid free gel ink flows onto your writing surface like no other. It's very reliable, and starts flowing as soon as it hits the paper. No scribbling to get it going. Made in Japan.

Mechanism:  For motion control, we've gone with the Schmidt Easy Glide for super clean, satisfying twist motion engagement. Machined from stainless steel and thermoplastic, it has a 'lock in' feature. Once the cartridge is extended to its full length it will lock in place, preventing retraction until turned back in the other direction. Made in Germany

Clip:  Manufactured in New England from proper spring steel. This important part is chrome plated and DLC coated in models with black detail. Made in USA

Design Features
Fits Parker size refills
Tactile Grip Detail
Balanced Center of Mass 
Fully machined from solid stock
Anodized aluminum Twist Button
Black versions coated with DLC 
Solid in hand feel
No play tight tolerance tip
Recessed clip locator pocket

How We Manufacture
By using Swiss-type turning techniques, our two man team (Adam & Ryan) are able to deliver parts that are extremely accurate- tolerances usually reserved for medical and aerospace industries. 
Machine Era Shop | Richmond, Va
 What Is DLC? 
Diamond-Like Carbon (DLC) is a type of PVD coating, it’s impact resistant, and almost impossible to scratch. DLC coatings are used in sectors that require highly precise and extremely durable components – it's commonly used in performance racing, aircraft, firearm, and fine watch industries.
About Machine Era
At Machine Era, we strive to create high quality machined goods at great price points. We use top grade materials and keep prices as low as we can by manufacturing all of our products in our shop in Richmond, Virginia.
Your support allows us to continue to develop and produce high quality products at the best price we can offer.
If you don't know Machine Era, you can see our full catalog at machine-era.com. Our products have also been featured by the following publications:

campaign.story:
Meet Sketchmark, the pocket-size tool for everyone. Sketchmark packs over 15 essential tools for journaling, sketching, and designing into a slim credit card-sized form. Use Sketchmark to create a bullet journal, check architectural blueprints in the field, or doodle in your sketchbook. Best yet, the functional design of the protractor makes Sketchmark the perfect bookmark for your journal or textbook (see below!)
 JOURNAL + DESIGN + SKETCH
While most stencils are designed for one type of user, we created a versatile stencil card that can be used by anybody. To do so, we combined the best features for journaling, sketching, and designing into a single tool. Whether you are an architect needing a compass and ruler in the field, or a student trying to organize your schedule, Sketchmark has the right tools for you!
15+ ESSENTIAL TOOLS
Each Sketchmark is precision machined from aluminum and engraved with a laser on both sides. Featuring both metric and imperial units, Sketchmark can be used around the world. Learn more about the features below and get inspired to create more with Sketchmark.  
Imperial ruler (3")
Metric ruler (7cm)
Imperial compass
Metric compass
3/8" circle stencil
Bookmark stencil
Protractor
Pie chart guide
Isometric guide
Bullet journal stencils (circles, squares, dashes)
RFID blocking
Other uses: T-Square, straightedge, ruled line guide, arc stencil, credit card stencil, corner rounder, and more...
Metric compass sizes: 8mm, 12mm, 16mm, 2cm, 3cm, 4cm, 5cm, 6cm, 8cm, 10 cm, 12cm
Imperial compass sizes: 1/2", 3/4", 1", 1.25", 1.5", 2", 2.5", 3", 3.5", 4", 4.5", 5"
Isometric guide: Easy 30 degree alignment guides to create isometric drawings
Sketchmark's possibilities are endless! Check out a few samples of what is possible with Sketchmark below!
SKETCHMARK SPECS
Size: 85.6mm x 53.98mm (credit card dimensions)
Thickness: .3mm
Material: 6061 anodized aluminum (RFID blocking)
Markings: Laser engraved
PROJECT TIMELINE

campaign.story:
Important: By backing this project you confirm that you are not Anish Kapoor, you are in no way affiliated to Anish Kapoor, you are not backing this on behalf of Anish Kapoor or an associate of Anish Kapoor. To the best of your knowledge, information and belief this material will not make its way into the hands of Anish Kapoor.
There's none more black!
Black 3.0 is a super special acrylic paint. We have spent nearly 2 years tweaking its formulation to create a black that absorbs between 98 and 99% of visible light! Quite simply we've created the blackest black acrylic paint.
Black 3.0 brush applied to sculpture
Last November we shared a beta batch of Black 3.0 with 1000 artists around the world for feedback and thoughts. We've now taken that information and reformulated it to be the best black we could possibly make. 
All the photos and video content on this page are created with the final formulation of Black 3.0 from the UK factory that are producing it for us, we are excited to be playing with it and feel like it's perfect!
We need your help so that we can pay the paint factory to produce their minimum order quantity of our recipe so we can share our creation with everyone!
 The science behind the Black!
We wanted a super-flat, ultra-matte black that absorbed almost all visible light. To achieve that we went right back to the basics of paint making. The problem with existing black pigments is they are all slightly reflective (carbon is the most common and if you think of coal or charcoal you'll know it has a shine to it), so we created a whole new pigment in the lab and we call it 'Black Magick', it is born matte! This means that the mattifiers we used in Black 2.0, which added a tiny grey tint, are no longer needed making a way blacker looking paint! We've also managed to formulate a new acrylic polymer to hold the pigment, it's special because it has more available bonds than any other acrylic polymer being used in paints. This means it can cling onto way more pigment, leading to a really dense pigment load and a depth of colour not previously possible. We have sourced some brand new nano-mattifiers which we have added, these flatten out the last bits of stray light without compromising colour. 
Unedited comparison with other well known black paints
We have benchmarked Black 3.0 against 45 existing black paints, this photo demonstrates a small section of those, being the most commonly available black paints in the UK. We also sent beta versions of Black 3.0 to 1000 artists around the world, they filled in a questionnaire and 93% of them preferred it to our Black 2.0 (previously the worlds flattest mattest black). 
It's super easy to use.
Other super blacks are complicated to use and extremely expensive. Most require heat, science labs and specialist training to apply. We wanted to make a super affordable, easy to use paint that was familiar to artists so they could concentrate on expressing themselves. 
We think that sharing your colours with others is nice! When Stuart heard that Kapoor was the only artist that could use the blackest black he felt sad but also a bit bad that he'd been making awesome colours and only using them in his own work. So he started sharing his colour creations on the internet with other artists. 
The holy grail of paints is the ultimate zero-point black. We've been on a mission to create exactly that for a long while because we want all artists to be able to express themselves with awesome materials. The limits of your creations should be your imagination not how rich or successful you are. 
We are a small team of artists and paint makers based in a studio in Dorset on the south coast of England. We are headed up by British artist Stuart Semple who has been making his own colours for nearly 20 years. 
We've created and shared tens of thousands of the artiest art materials with artists all over the world including LIT (the world's glowiest glow pigment). PINK (the pinkest pink), Gold (the goldest gold), Black 2.0 (the mattest flattest black paint), Dazzle (the glitteriest plant based glitters) and many more creations. 
You can see what we make and learn all about us on our website:
culturehustle.com
No matter what reward you choose you will get at least one bottle of Black 3.0 but your support means so much to us we wanted to thank you properly. Stuart and his team have been busy over the last few weeks designing the rewardiest rewards to thank you properly! These will only ever be available to kickstarter backers! He's come up with commemorative mugs, notebooks, sticker and badge packs and even a gorgeous organic screenprinted 'haus' street sack bag. Below are actual photos of the actual rewards you will receive :)  We hope you enjoy them as much as we enjoyed making them!

2018 was our most successful campaign ever, and we are back for 2019 hoping to break that record once again!
This year, we will be at the 2019 Atlanta Pen Show from April 5th through 7th, which includes a live recording of The Pen Addict Podcast with Ana, Brad, and Myke on the evening of April 6th.
On top of that, we are heading across the country to the Bay Area to attend the 2019 San Francisco Pen Show from August 23rd to 25th. And that’s not all! For the first time, we will be recording a second live podcast on the tour. The San Francisco Pen Show promoters have graciously allocated space for us on Friday evening, the 23rd, to record in front of a live audience. We couldn’t be more excited!
Nock Co. is back once again with the campaign rewards, this time with a much requested case design. They are finally ready to release a stand-alone A5 pouch! While it will be similar in style and shape to the A5 case sold with the Lanier briefcase, there is an added feature we think you all will love: The case exterior will be made from waxed canvas.
This is a micro-weave waxed canvas which they have tested in small batches previously, and think it is a perfect match for this case. The interior will be made from the standard 400D pack cloth in Lime Green, and one of the interior pockets has been updated to include pen slots.
Below is the digital mock-up of the design, with pictures of the final prototype being added to the campaign in a week or two.
Update: The Burton Prototype has arrived! See this update for all of the details. Here are a few pics to get you started...
We are also adding in a fun Pen Addict-themed sticker sheet as part of the campaign this year at the $50 level, designed by the awesome Ana Reinert. We will add the digital mock-up of the sheet once Ana returns from the road trip of a lifetime out to Los Angeles.
Update: Check out the sticker sheet!
So, who is ready for an amazing 2019?

Project Note (Feb 10): Due to the tremendous reception of the Spoke Pen project, we've closed 'June Delivery' rewards and added new 'August Delivery' rewards.  Our goal remains to get everything done as quickly as possible and beat our listed delivery dates.  Thanks for the support!
We know what you are thinking, and we will go ahead and answer it for you. Yes, Kickstarter does need another pen project. Especially this one.
Say hello to the Spoke Pen.
The Spoke Pen is a collaboration between Brian Conti of Spoke Design, and Brad Dowdy of The Pen Addict. And, most importantly, is built to specifically fit the best gel ink refill in the world: The Uni-ball Signo UM-151, also known as the Uni-ball Signo DX.
The Signo DX is a smooth-flowing, clean-writing, rich-color gel ink pen. Its quality among its competition in unsurpassed, yet on Kickstarter, the Signo DX has been mostly overlooked.
Spoke brings an instantly recognizable design: A streamlined geometric-deco style in a world of minimal cylindrical machined pens. We're not knocking minimal design, but everything can't be minimal!  
the machined pen that's MACHINED A LOT!
The Spoke Pen features aluminum barrel construction, grip materials in aluminum or titanium, a magnetic cap for secure closure, and wide range of anodized aluminum colors. For you tech-spec geeks out there, here are the specifics:
As important as the specifications are, it was very important for us to get the feel of this pen right. We started prototyping all of the parts in June 2018, and went through many iterations to get to the final result we have today. The Spoke Pen feels light, but substantial. It is rock-solid and durable, but gets out of the way when writing with it or carrying it. It is high quality, and comfortable. The Spoke Pen is your new favorite pen.
The goal of the Spoke Pen campaign is to make the best barrel for the Uni-ball Signo DX on the planet. And, to have fun doing it by offering a wide range of colors in this campaign. Assuming it all goes well, after we successfully fulfill the Kickstarter we plan to periodically release future Spoke Pen 'editions' with more unique color combinations and materials. And yes, we may eventually make it for other refills too, such as the Pilot G2. 
 Spoke Pen Classic Series: $60 Aluminum Grip / $65 Titanium Grip
The classic colorway has matching anodized barrel and cap, with black anodized accents (clip, ends, and slot see-through).  It is available with a black anodized grooved aluminum grip or a machined grooved titanium grip.  The Titanium grip is slightly heavier than the aluminum... and as a bare machined part it is a bit 'grippier' than the aluminum.
Barrel color choices: Black, Blue, Red, Lime, Purple, Orange, and Rub/Brushed Aluminum
Spoke Pen Classic Series colorway (black anodized grip)
Spoke Pen Classic... aluminum barrel with Titanium grip.
 Spoke Pen Edition Series: 
1) The Joker, $60
Purple Cap, Lime body, Black Aluminum grip, Black clip, Purple sleeve, lime top cap, purple end cap.
Spoke Pen Edition Series... the Joker
2) Orange Crush, $65
Orange body, Titanium grip, Nickel clip, Aluminum see-through, Aluminum end caps (metal stamped Spoke 'S' on cap end). 
Spoke Pen Edition Series: Orange Crush
All pens ship with a Uni-ball Signo UMR-1-05 Black 0.5 mm gel pen refill.
We've concepted, prototyped, and iterated using 3D printing and machining. The design is now complete. Brian leads the manufacturing stage and has extensive experience with prior Spoke projects. While he has the ability to make prototypes and product in small quantities, we choose to work with professional machine shops to produce production quantity parts. While Spoke has traditionally utilized only domestic shops, the Spoke Pen will use a combination of US and overseas shops. Brian has lots of experience with overseas shops from his corporate days. The overseas shops have a good ability to deal with anodizing a broad range of colors over a relatively small quantity of parts. The plan is to use a specific shop in Shenzhen that Brian has experience with for the aluminum parts requiring anodize and the US shop Brian traditionally works with for the straight machined parts.
Each Pen has 10 custom parts. These will be brought in individually and everything will be inspected, assembled, packaged, and shipped out by Brian & Brad. There's quite a bit of work that goes into assembling each pen, and we'll show the process as the project moves along.
A high level overview of the timeline is as follows ...
Brian Conti is a design engineer and founder of Spoke Design.  Brian runs a small product development company with his brother Dan (Conti-Bros, Inc.). Their brands include Strong Like Bull Magnets, Yaket, and Baux.
Brad Dowdy has been writing stationery reviews online at The Pen Addict since 2007, co-hosts The Pen Addict Podcast, and makes pen cases and paper goods at Nock Co.
Will <insert refill here> fit the Spoke Pen?
Yes: Uni-ball Signo 207/307, Uni-ball RT1, Pentel Energel, Zebra Sarasa Clip
No: Pilot G2, Pilot Juice, Pilot Hi-Tec-C, Pentel Slicci, Pentel Hybrid Technica, Parker-style.
Will <insert refill here> EVER fit the Spoke Pen?
At some point in the future we will design a Spoke Pen model to fit other refills.
Does the pen cap post on the back the pen?
No, it doesn't. This is to reduce length in use, lower writing weight, and provide better weight distribution and balance.
Thanks for visiting the project. We look forward to getting Spoke Pen into your hands!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The Spoke Pen project brings together two veterans of running successful Kickstarter projects. As noted above, we've spent a good amount of time prototyping to get the design to a production ready point. We have good experience producing machined pencils and other products, and we have good experience with the overall Kickstarter process (funding/manufacturing/fulfillment). The main 'risk' is the delivery timeline. We'll be working with outside supplier partners, and so at times we'll have somewhat limited ability to 'push' to get things done. Overall, we're confident we'll get the project done with great results.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

I’m sending a quick note to let you know about our two new projects. While together, Brad and I make up Spoke Design… we continue to do projects individually as well.

Hello all... we hope this message finds you well!
We're happy to report we're DONE* with fulfillment of Spoke Pen! The asterisk is there as we're still waiting on a handful of project surveys... but we've shipped everything we can at this point.
A few items to close out the project...
1- THANK YOU for supporting us! We appreciate your belief in us and we hope you like the pens.

Hello all... we hope this message finds you well!
'Where is my pen?'...

Hello all... we hope this message finds you well!
'Where is my pen?'... the answer for 2/3 of backers is we're still working hard on them. We're 1/3 shipped, which is obviously not meeting the goal of getting this project completed in July. 
At this point we've got all backers below backer #270 shipped... and overall we're well past 300 backers shipped. With an overall 'average' of 1.4 pens per backer, we've made almost 500 pens to date... but we still have a lot more to go!

Hello all... we hope this update finds you well!
As always, we understand the most important question to be answered in a post-funding update is... when do I get my rewards?
At this moment it is June 28th and we've shipped to 16% of our backers. Around three dozen backers received their pens in May ahead of schedule... another hundred plus backers received them on time this month of June.  Unfortunately, we're not going to meet our goal of getting all of the June backers shipped in the next few days. We take our goals very seriously, and so we are disappointed we're coming up short on the goal. Ultimately, our color mismatch issue created the initial delay, and as we both have lots of moving parts to our various businesses, we just weren't able to get our timing synced back up and realigned for June.

Hello... and a Happy May to everyone!
We hope this update finds everyone well...the year is rapidly moving along on us!
Schedule Update - On Track!  
We're starting to receive parts right on schedule. This is both an exciting and anxious time... we need all of the components to come in and meet our dimensional and cosmetic requirements so we can start assembly. So far, so good... so we're right on track! Our next update will have lots of part pictures!

Hello everyone and Happy April!  It's been a quiet beginning to the month with respect to Spoke Pen... but things are getting closer to picking up in a big way.
Schedule
We're happy to report that at this point, all of the pen components are on track to arrive by the end of this month... putting us in position to get some initial quantities assembled and shipped ahead of schedule in May. Stay tuned!

Hello everybody... we hope this message finds you well!  A quick update on Spoke Pen progress...  
Schedule. Kickstarter funds will likely deposit early next week... fortunately we only had a handful of dropped backers. As we've previously detailed, due to the great reception of the project, we were able to get a head start on parts orders. There are quite a few pen parts... and at the moment the various parts are scheduled be received in the mid-April through early May time period.  So, we're still on track to be able to ship some quantity of pens ahead of schedule.  We'll continue to keep everyone posted.  Updates will be a bit more exciting as parts start to roll in!

Hello all!  A quick note on Spoke Pen surveys...
1- We've received close to 80% of the surveys so far... thanks to those who've gotten them in!  Those who still have surveys to fill out, it would be a big help to us if you could complete them soon... thanks!
2- We did have a bit of a 'hiccup' by advising backers they could increase their pledges to go from Aluminum to Ti grips or to multiple pens without changing reward tiers during active funding.  The result was that since the surveys are specifically tailored to each tier, some options were not available (such as Ti grips in a Aluminum grip reward tier).  Each survey does have a 'text input' field, and we've been advising backers to use this to communicate any details needed and we'll make sure you get what you backed for.  We didn't think this through properly and apologize for the confusion and inconvenience... if there are still questions or concerns, simply DM us and we'll get it sorted out.

Introducing the Accessport Air
Bluetooth 5, aptX / aptX low latency / AAC enabled wireless adapter with amazing sound that brings back the headphone jack to your mobile phones. Wirelessly.
Accessport Air connects to your mobile device wirelessly via Bluetooth connection, and provides music output to your wired headphones and earphones.  You don’t need a dongle, dangling from your phone anymore.
Accessport Air is light-weight and compact and features a convenient clip-on design that allows it to hook onto your shirt or jeans.  Its controls are easy and intuitive, with a future-proof USB-C charging port that allows you to continue listening while charging.
Accessport Air is designed and developed from the ground up to be the best bang-for-the-buck Bluetooth receiver.  Each components and specifications has been hand-picked for it to be the most cutting-edge, the most battery efficient and the best sound output per dollar.  Its development took more than 2 years, with the entire Bluetooth solutions revised several times as the new Bluetooth 5 technology became available.

campaign.story:
Hi. I’m Shing Yin Khor, and for the past several years, I’ve been painting strange and wonderful creature friends. They appear in my webcomic, Otherworld Science, in gallery shows across the United States, and at several conventions and events annually. I’ve often been asked to compile them into an art book, and I finally have!
finished paintings on my workbench(technically a work floor, in this case).
Strange Friends is a postcard book featuring 20 paintings of odd creatures, furry, scaled, blerpy, and/or horned. It will be offset printed on a lush felted paper, and each postcard will be a art-print quality piece of art. The cover will be a lovely thick cardstock, with foil printing! I make beautiful objects, and I intend to make this one as fancy as I can!
Of course, I am a very practical person, so they are also nice postcards that should be sent to people you like. 
Here are some of the creatures that will be in the Strange Friends postcard book.
Good friends. Much friends.
This is a very straightforward Kickstarter - you can buy the postcard book, or buy multiple copies of the book. That's because I just want to make this book, and I want to make it a beautiful and special object! There is a one fancier option, where I'll hand-wrap the book for you so you can give it as a very thoughtful gift. For Kickstarter's Make 100 program, I am also making a care package edition, which allows me to indulge in telling weird little narratives through ephemera and other objects.
Here is a draft of what the cover will look like! I'll be hand painting it, and updating you on its progress in Kickstarter updates. The pink bits will be rendered on the cover in shiny foil! 
Digital First Draft - Strange Friends cover.
The Make 100 Care Package edition
I love making care packages, as my long-time Patreon subscribers can attest to, and this is a lovingly hand curated care-package of the Strange Friends postcard book, limited edition prints, heartfelt letters from fictional girls, and other delightful handmade ephemera and found objects. I don't want to spoil the arc of the tiny-story-in-a-package, but the keywords are: mysterious disappearances, summer camp, and special beasts. 
I’m using this as a platform to experiment with new found object narratives that won’t be available anywhere else!
Combining pledge levels
Please pledge at the highest pledge reward level listed that you would like, and add the additional cost of other reward levels you want to your pledge. 
Costs, and other details.
Printing costs for this book, including proofing, fancy foil printing, felted paper, and shipping from Malaysia, will cost approximately $11,500.00. I'll be printing an initial run of 2000 copies, and have budgeted an additional $4000 for shipping costs, print consulting fees, and production of the care package items. I'm requesting a little bit under this as my goal, as I will be funding approximately 1/3rd of the project myself.
The print consultant for this project is Rhiannon Rasmussen-Silverstein and music used in the video is Lobo Loco's Glueworm Evening Blues, from the Free Music Project.

updates.update_content:
As of this update, the Kickstarter is 86% fulfilled! That means that the majority of you have received your packages, and there are only 124 packages left to go! I am so grateful for my fulfillment partners at White Squirrel for handling the majority of this shipping and getting them all out to you safely! 
The ones that are left are:
Some in the gift wrap tier that have special requests like writing gift tags(I do this personally!)
Most of the Make 100 tier, as I am hand assembling these myself and want to make sure that they all get the care they deserve!

My pallet of books is here!! There is another pallet headed to my fulfillment partner in a week or so, which means that books are going to START heading out very soon! I hope to start mailing the gift-wrapped books this week, and then we’ll get to the other tiers real soon.
They look so so good! I am so excited and happy and thankful!!
This is a reminder to fill out your surveys and check your addresses(I’ve allowed address updates)!!

I wasn't planning on putting a little sketchbook together this month, but it turns out I won't have my Strange Friends books in time for SDCC. I expected the shipment to arrive in late June, but with some deadline slippage on my end, the shipments will arrive in late July instead. This means that generally, all Kickstarter shipments promised for June are delayed by about a month, although I think that the ones promised for August and September will ship on time. I am sorry! It is hard to predict printer and cargo ship schedules.
However, surveys to get your address will be going out this week!

I got the bound proofs of Strange Friends in right before I left for some travel, and they look GREAT! The spot foil on the cover turned out beautifully, and it is exactly what I wanted!
Now, I wait for all the books to be printed, and then they will sit on a large cargo vessel for some weeks. I think we are still on track for the first batch to ship in July(give or take a couple weeks, which in the grand scheme of Kickstarter projects...I hope you will forgive me if they arrive in very early August!).

Getting into longer term projects means a lot of waiting, which is a very new thing for me. I've really gotten used to the cycle of making something, getting it up on the internet, and then getting it printed within weeks for a convention or show....my conception-to-product cycle is usually only about two months at longest! But, I do want to do more involved work, both with publishers and independently, and it is...a lot of waiting. I funded Strange Friends back in February(yay, we are awesome), and we are on track for printing soon and shipping in July(the books will spend over a month in a boat), but I JUST got the digital proofs for Strange Friends and they look great!

updates.update_userinfo: We did it! (And a cover preview!)
updates.update_content:
I'm late on this "yaaay, we funded" email, but I didn't want to dump an essentially meaningless update in your inbox, and I figured we could celebrate together once I got a little bit more progress to show you!
Yesterday, I started painting the cover for this book, and I thought you might want to have a look, as well as get a peek into my painting process.
I usually start with blue outlines on already primed watercolor paper, but in this case, I was less confident about all the elements that went on the page, so I did the sketch first(it is difficult to erase even the blue pencil on painted paper). You can see the start of the brown wash that form the background of most of my paintings.

I've had a few questions about what the back of the postcards look like. I wanted them to be simple but thoughtful, match the front of the postcards, and feel like they were custom made by a crypto-naturalist sending postcards from the field. 
The postcards will all have a short description of the creature on the front, as well as a few small spot illustrations. There are five different illustrated backs, and some of then have some extra drawings(like surprise mushrooms and worms!) peeking out.

campaign.story:
"Worrying is like paying a debt you don't owe"
-Mark Twain
The most remarkable thing about this favorite quote of mine is the simplicity and truth behind it. We worry almost constantly and there's nothing in this world saying that we have to. It doesn't change anything or fix the problem, but we do it anyway. We constantly pull from our bank of emotions and hormones to pay for this debt that doesn't exist. 
How worrying can affect your body
Chronic worrying can lead to the triggering of fight or flight which causes the body's sympathetic nervous system to release stress hormones. Those hormones cause physical reactions like dizziness, fatigue, headache, inability to concentrate, nausea and shortness of breath to name a few. If excessive worrying and high anxiety go untreated, they can lead to depression. These effects are a response to stress. Whether or not you become ill depends on how you handle stress and there are things you can do to alter the way you respond.*
Here are a few things that can be helpful
Exercise
Eat a healthy diet
Don't drink too much caffeine
Learn to relax
Meditate
Be conscious of your worries
*I'm not a doctor. I just read a lot and have dealt with worry, anxiety and stress like all of us.
A few years ago, I started manually machining various types of Worry Coins. They vary in metals, woods and sizes. Last year I had the idea that I'd laser engrave this quote into a coin but it was missing something and made these hand made coins even more expensive. I really wanted to be able to offer a more affordable version of a Worry Coin with this quote but, at the time, was not aware of Shire Post Mint's ability to create a concave surface on one side, so I shelved the project. A few months later, I saw what they could do with a coin so reached out to my favorite designer, Mike Major, and got to work. I couldn't be happier with the result. The size, weight, design and cost are the perfect balance and I'm sure you will enjoy.
Check out the coin page on my website to see some of the original hand made versions.
www.jllawsonco.com
Is this coin the answer to your worries?
I don't believe there is one answer to all anxiety or worry but I do believe that an object like a "worry stone/coin" can aide in self soothing. Here's a little excerpt about the origin of worry stones.
From the perspective of cognitive behavior therapy, the use of worry stones is one of many folk practices that can function as psychologically healthy self-soothing exercises. Such techniques are imparted at an early stage of treatment, displacing any familiar but destructive coping methods (nail-biting, scratching, lip-biting, etc.) that the patient may have developed. This helps ready the patient to safely confront anxiety or trauma. Worry stones are simple and intuitive enough to be useful in therapeutic contexts where complexity and unfamiliarity are paramount concerns, such as when offering short-term treatment to refugees or children with post-traumatic stress disorder. After a patient has mastered a more sophisticated relaxation script for anxiety management, the worry stone itself can serve as a physical 'relaxation script reminder'; the patient may notice an impulse to use the object, and thereby become aware of their own anxiety.  The rubbing of the stone can create a sense of relaxation making the mind more relaxed and generating a sense of calmness.  There are also people that may use them during meditation practices, this is known to center a persons concentration benefiting the meditation
The soothing, repetitive motion of rubbing this concave coin is the perfect conduit to being present.
Learn to relax, meditate and be conscious of your worries. This coin helps with all of those. Meditation equals relaxing but it doesn't have to mean sitting on a pillow in the lotus position. Meditating is being present and breathing. The soothing, repetitive motion of rubbing the concave coin is the perfect conduit. It's also a good way to remind yourself to let the worry go.
Most importantly, carry this coin to remind yourself that worrying won't change the problem you're anticipating.
The original inspiration for my Worry Coins were traditional worry stones.
The difference between worry and concern
Am I saying that you should never be concerned about a current or potential problem? Of course not, but take steps to handle the problem and let it go. I used to have a ton of trouble sleeping at night because I'd lay there thinking of all the things I needed to do in the near or distant future. In other words, I'm laying there worrying about it when there was absolutely nothing I could do about it at the time...I'm supposed to be sleeping! The worst part is that the majority of those worries never even came true...that debt I didn't owe again.

Check out our website or add $35 to your pledge to get the top below with your coin. This Micro Top is a bit of an homage to my dad. He made the original around five years ago as a joke before the spinning top craze took off. I've had it on my desk since.

Domestic shipping is easy and affordable but some International customers may feel that the shipping cost is excessive so I thought a little explanation was in order.  To ship one of these coins the right way, it has to be considered a "package" which is now a minimum of $13 for most countries ($9 for Canada). A 1 oz package costs me $13-$15 to ship. I don't pad the cost in any way. The only option that is cheaper than that is to ship a "document" and ranges $4-$8. The problem with this is that it's not a document so your package can get held up or sent back and it's just not worth the trouble. I know that other creators and companies sometimes charge less for International shipping but I can't tell you exactly why. Possibly they get better bulk rate, possibly they are shipping the product incorrectly or, more likely, they are padding the cost of the product with shipping costs to make it look like the shipping is cheaper or free. The fact is that shipping is shipping and no company can just absorb shipping costs unless they are making up the difference somewhere else. Thanks for your understanding.
About us
J. L. Lawson & Co. was founded in 2011 with the idea to machine some rings and have a side gig. My dad was a manual machinist in the middle of the desert so work wasn't easy to come by. The company began to grow in 2012 so pops had to start training me (Anthony) in the shop. We made some spinning tops that year and machining was kicked into high gear since then. A few years ago, I came up with the idea to have a Decision Maker coin minted and found Shire Post Mint. This is my fifth coin design from the Shire and I couldn't be happier with the results. Finding good vendors for various businesses I've had has always been a nightmare so it's a true pleasure to find someone that I can trust and rely on. I believe Mike Major was sent to me via the universe when I realized that he was not only a customer of mine but I had been following a company that he was part of. He'd done the graphics for Wool and Prince and I kept meaning to reach out to them to ask who did there work. Before I could do that, Mike reached out to me to tell me how much he like the products he purchased from me and I noticed his email address was from Wool and Prince. Madness. To date, the trio of myself, Shire Post (Woody) and Mike Major has been the perfect marriage of talents and I'm sure there are many more pieces to come.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is my 11th Kickstarter campaign so I've gotten pretty streamlined with the process. The biggest challenges with any campaign are manufacturing and fulfillment of the product. My manufacturer is the best (in any industry) that I've worked with and has never let me down. They are always ahead of schedule and provide an amazing product every time. The dies for the coins are sitting and waiting to mint out thousands of O2 Worry Coins! 
The second biggest challenge is fulfillment but we always use Backerkit to stream line the process and have enough experience to get through it with few snags.
That said, something always comes up. That's the nature of creating products for the consumer market. It's inevitable but we have enough experience now to get over those hurdles with ease and get your reward to you in a timely manner.

campaign.story:
Deluge, a Fountain Pen by Genesis - At the crossroads of technology and traditional handcraft
The Deluges Series
The Myths: 
Ancient Deluge mythology first appeared in the Eridu Genesis around 3000 BC in Mesopotamia. Ziusudra, a man well known for his humility and obedience. Ziusudra did as Sumer God commanded him and built a huge boat, in which he successfully rode out the flood. Then similar stories were then appeared in Epic Atrahasis (1500 BC), Epic of Gilgamesh, Deucalion in Greek folk mythology, Noah in Genesis, and so on.
The Deluges Stories
The Design: 
Deluge is the first series fountain pen released by our team, Genesis Pen. They tributes to the cultural heroes in the Deluge mythology by using the unique interior barrel design. The transparent barrel refracts the unique internal ink chamber. It assembled with a stack of rectangular blocks representing the Tablet of Eridu Genesis. Each layer of block rotates 11 degrees symbolizes the Deluge story in the Tablet XI of Epic of Gilgamesh. The whole structure consists of 50 layers of blocks and assembles as a helical structure that emulates the DNA 3D structure, the fundamental molecule of life. The ink chamber capacity is approximately 3 ml, which is larger than most ink cartridges, converters, and piston fillers. The Deluge initially comes with three styles named Ziusudra, Atrahasis, and Deucalion, after the historical heroes in the Deluge stories. Furthermore, we will release Noah, when the Stretch Goal is reached.
Close-up of the metal rings
The ink channel
Ziusudra with ink
Ziusudra with ink
Models:
Deluge - Ziusudra
Ziusudra
Ziusudra with the cap on
Ziusudra comes with the unique glass-like resin with golden rings. The hand-painted golden helix symbol and the sliver/gold two-tone nib make Ziusudra unique. 
 Deluge - Atrahasis
Atrahasis
Atrahasis, a fully transparent demonstrator comes with silver color German-made stain steel nib.
Deluge - Deucalion  
Deucalion
Deucalion, with unique triple black design together with a black ruthenium plated steel nib, makes it one-of-a-kind fountain pen in the market. 
The Making of: 
To construct such a complicated ink chamber structure inside the narrow pen barrel will not be successful without the use of edge-cutting technology, the Stereolithography (SLA) 3D Resin Printing. This technology uses light to solidify liquid photocrosslinking resins into a rigid solid resin. This technology opens up a new horizon in fountain pen design. 
Material: Fountain pen users have a high requirement and expectation towards fountain pen's materials and their durability. We have been searching for resins that give satisfaction texture and at the same time, compatible to SLA 3D printing. After a lot of trial and error, we finally identified the ideal material by using a self-formulated photo-crosslinking resin that is ideal for the fountain pen. After constructed by state-of-the-art 3D printing technology, the material will be solidified and remains strong, transparent, and unique. The material is resistant to water, methanol, ethanol, propanol, acetone, and most other organic solvents. Stable up to 200˚C heating. The Deluge series uses the hollow eye-dropper type of ink filling system. To facilitate pen washing, we paid a lot of effort in formulating the resin that can make the pen washing and writing be enjoyable. The rings on the pen are costed-bronze, which is shinny and rust resisting. 
Handcrafting: SLA 3D printing together with the self-formulated resin only took us halfway in reaching our goal. After printing, the material is rough and non-transparent that does not look like a pen that people will love. In order to solve this problem, we recruited a specialist to our team who has good pen polishing skills. We spent a lot of time researching the best polishing process for this new type of material. Finally, we came up with a series of processes to turn the printed "object" into a unique fountain pen that is transparent and rigid, yet feels smooth and warm like ebonite. 
Before and after hand-polishing
Pen washing has been a lot of people's concern, therefore we are adding a pen washing video to show the ease of cleaning. With our self-formulated resin, we ensure the ink will not be trapped in the ink chamber. 
PLAY

Specifications:
Length: 142.6 mm caped. 112 mm without the cap. (Cap cannot be posted)
Diameter: 14.5 mm
Weight: 25.5g 
System: Eye-dropper ink chamber (~3 ml)
Material: Self-formulated photocrosslinking Resin
Colors: Glass-like (Ziusudra); Transparent (Atrahasis); Triple Black (Deucalion); Transparent Red (Noah, Stretch goal item)
Nibs: Extra fine, fine, medium, board, and stub German-made JOWO #6 steel nib will be available/Fine, medium, and board German-madeJOWO #6 14k gold nib 
Customisation: We do provide engraving services to our backers. 1-2 alphabets of European languages or 1 Traditional/Simplified Chinese, Japanese, and Korean character can be engraved on the top of the pen with hand painted gold color.
Engraved and gold-painted Chinese character "Dragon" at the top of the pen.
Packaging: Each Deluge fountain pen will be protected by an aluminum case. All the pens will be shipped in a paper box or thick envelope to ensure zero damage to the pen during the shipment.
All the pens will be packed in aluminum cases.
Stretch Goals:
HKD$150,000 (USD~$19,200) - Unlock new style - Noah at HKD$799 (USD~%103). 
HKD$200,000 (USD~$25,680) - Everyone who pledges will reward a leather pen bag.
HKD$300,000 (USD~$38,000) - Unlock unique Deluge pen stand at the price of HKD$100. (USD~$13)
Noah
Sneak Peek of Deluge Pen Stand
Timeline:
Early 2016 - Designing a fountain pen with unique ink channels.
End of 2016 - the First prototype of Deluge was made.
2017 - Searching for materials, prototyping and modifying the design.
Jan 2018 - Researching on surface finishing process and nibs ordering
Aug 2018 - Starting Kickstarter campaign.
Oct 2018 - Production Starts
April 2019 - Shipping out the early bird rewards
May 2019 - Shipping out the rest of the orders

campaign.story:
The Utility Knife Blade is an extremely useful tool, especially in the hand of a maker. Its uses are almost endless, yet few people use it. Why?
Because there is no holder designed to fit the needs of us makers.
So we decided to make one.
The Maker Knife is a tool made to be carried every day, everywhere you go. It is compact, lightweight, super quick and easy to open. No more looking for a blade. No more interruptions while you’re working on a project. The Maker Knife is always there, ready to swiftly help you work more efficiently.
- Jimmy Diresta
          Oh yeah did we mention it’s freaking magic? The locking mechanism is extremely easy to use. There are no buttons to push. No weird finger movements to do. You can just flick it open with your thumb or a finger.
The blade holder automatically locks securely into place when it reaches the top and by witchcraft unlocks when you pull it back down. It really does feel like magic!
"WTF!?? How does it work?" - That guy in a red shirt that tried to figure out the mechanism for 2 minutes while pushing it back and forth.
No springs, just magic.
          More magic! Pretty cool right? And this is without the use of springs! It's all you. You see the Maker Knife is adjustable. You can choose from a range of "almost impossible to open" to "wrist flick to open". Both offer great holding strength while retracted (no worrying about it opening in your pocket), and you can tune it to feel just the way you want it to feel.
It's also a fantastic feature for increasing the "child safety" factor of the knife as you can make it require a lot of force to open. (Obviously don't let kids anywhere near a knife of any kind though)
We made it for you, and us.
We love the utility knife blades because you can scrape, pry, cut, chop, stab, sand or whatever without worrying about them getting chipped, dull, bent or broken. They are cheap and easy to find at hardware stores, so you can just swap the blade when it gets worn out and have a new flawless, razor sharp edge in seconds.
          What we don't like is the lack of a good way to hold them. Most handles are bulky and heavy, mainly made for industrial applications. - That won't work for us makers!
What we need is a convenient, super quick knife that is lightweight and compact. A design that is made to be an EDC (Every Day Carry) item.
So we decided to make the Maker Knife.
Here we are, five months later, with a finished design. You would think designing a holder for a blade would be pretty straightforward right? But we didn't just want to make a stick and shove a blade on there. No, we wanted to make something so good that you would like to carry with you, all the time, every day.
Precision manufacuring
There were these extraordinarily complex problems that needed to be solved in order to achieve the magic feeling we were seeking. Some parts were impossible to mill using CNC machines, so we used extremely accurate EDM (Electrical Discharge Machining), making cuts that are no thicker than a human hair.
With a core of high strength stainless steel
Super quick to use in either hand
          It took many, many tries, prototypes and curse words to perfect this deceptively simple looking locking mechanism. A locking mechanism so intuitive and easy to use that you don't even think about it, you just use it, no matter which hand.
Some of the very early prototypes
You can even unlock the Maker Knife wearing thick gloves.
"You really don't have to think about using the Maker Knife. You're already done."
Did we mention it's waterproof?
"Unlocking the maker knife is the transition from a thought to an action. That is why we made it flawless."
The Maker Knife is available in two different finishes; Black or Silver.
The silver finish is very similar to a pretty well known computer model
The clip can be mounted on either side of the knife
Once the campaign is over, we will ask which finish you prefer, so you don't have to make this difficult decision just yet. Pledge now - choose later.
Materials
To ensure the best performance we made the core from high strength corrosion resistant stainless steel. The case is made from aerospace grade aluminium to keep the Maker Knife as light and agile as possible. This combination also means that the Maker Knife is waterproof.
Specs:
Height closed: 108mm
Height open: 140mm (with blade)
Width: 33mm
Thickness: 7.7mm
Weight: 65g (with blade)
About the thickness of a modern smartphone
This makes the Maker Knife very natural to carry
So that you can take it with you everywhere you go
This resulted in a knife that got its beauty through function
We really do believe we made the best utility knife. It's everything we ever wanted a utility knife to be. We think you will feel the same.
Ceramic blades
Ceramic utility knife blades? Yeah, they are really cool! Ceramic is really, really good at keeping an edge. You can cut foam, cardboard, leather, fabric and such and it will probably never go dull. It's fantastic for RC scratch builders, crafts, leather makers and many others.
But as always in life there are tradeoffs. Ceramic blades will chip when abused. Cutting very hard things like hard wood and such is not really its intended use. Use cheap metal blades that you can pick up local to you for stuff like that.
- Only available as part of the knife bundles during the Kickstarter-
Blades will be available on MakerKnife.com after the Kickstarter has ended. 
 The Diresta Maker Knife
Jimmy Diresta decided to launch a Diresta version of the Maker Knife with a custom brass top plate that he'll customize himself with his brand. The Diresta brass plate comes as an addition to the normal top plate in the color of your choice.
Diresta Maker Knife with Black Base
The Diresta Brass plate comes as an addition to the standard plate.
Help promoting this campaign by:
This project is promoted by Green Inbox Partner Program
Press Relations PressWisdom
 The Team
Two like-minded makers. The founder Giacomo (left) and the design partner David (right),
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
PLEASE BE ADVISED THAT THE REAL PRODUCT MIGHT DIFFER SLIGHTLY FROM PROTOTYPES SHOWN IN THE PICTURES ABOVE

All the funding will go towards making this project a reality. We need to make several molds and they can be quite expensive. It only makes sense to have them made if there is enough volume of parts being produced. That is why we are here on kickstarter! With your help we can make this tool. A tool we believe every makers will love. Makers unite to make a tool!

This is our first kickstarter project and it's going to be a excellent learning experience for us.
However it is not our first time doing product development and fulfilment. We have done both software and hardware before.

This has taught us a lot about the importance of finding quality suppliers. We have already spent a long time building relationships with the manufacturers we will use for this project and we feel pretty confident in their ability to deliver.

We feel well prepared, but like with any project there are always unforeseen challenges to overcome. We will try our utmost to deliver on time, but if we do run into any problems we will try to be as transparent as we can and communicate this to you here on kickstarter.

Thank you very much for supporting us in this endeavour. We hope you will be as happy with the Maker Knife as we are.
/Giacomo Di Muro with the help of David Windestål

campaign.story:
Hello Kickstarters, my name is Alain Benoit and I am exploring some of these symbols with the Cartomancer Poker Deck.
The inspiration behind my project. Tarot; French cartomancy; transformation deck; analytical psychology; art; surrealism; symbolism; fingerprints; vintage prints; and illustrations (to name only a few.) 
Why is this deck unique? Each card tells a story. The whole deck paints the landscape of our lives with vintage engravings and prints—the ideal synergy between significance and design in a pack of cards. There is nothing like it out there—that’s why I’m doing it! 
Cartomancy, divination? Yes, of course! The Catomancer Poker Deck uses the existing structure of a standard deck of cards as a canvas for a new insightful cartomancy system. ALL the cards feature universal archetypes and symbols making it a very instinctive tool for divination. But if you're not into this, you will still enjoy the deck for its beauty and uniqueness.
My dream will come true! When funded, each deck will be printed with the highest quality by the United States Playing Card Company. For me, the creation of this deck is THE quest to create playing cards I could see only in my dreams.
_____________________________
IMPORTANT: If you are from the United States, please select the rewards named “USA Shipping rate” or “USA” in order to get the proper price for your reward.
Diamond: Sensation, perception with our senses, childhood and earth. 
Spade: Thinking, becoming part of society, early adulthood and air. 
Heart: Intuition, abundance and fertility, midlife and water. 
Club:  Feeling, knowing without reasoning, late adulthood and fire.
As a tribute to the people who have gotten their hands dirty with ink creating the engravings featured in the deck, I have made the suit symbols with fingerprints. As a result, no suit symbol is ever repeated on the same card. For instance, the 10 of Diamonds has 10 different fingerprints!
The timeworn paper background of the front of each card is a section of a larger paper so that the background of each card is different (no annoying repeated markings anywhere.) Of course the backs are uniform for obvious reasons.
The meaning of each card is printed in the margin of the card in both English and French as a tribute to French Cartomancie.
The deck contains hundreds of engravings, sometimes as many as five different designs in the same card. There is always something new to discover every time you look at them.
Red Joker Unconsciousness: our deepest level of consciousness, a pool of desires, dreams, spirituality and emotions. 
Black Joker Consciousness: our individual awareness of the world: sensation, thinking, intuition and feeling. 
The ornaments on the tuck box and on the back of the cards are old foundry ornaments used in early printing.
I want to include with each deck a companion book. It will be a 32 page booklet the size of the box, containing an introduction to the deck, keyword meanings for each card, and ideas for divination. To produce the booklet and include it with each deck we need to reach the STRETCH GOAL of $16,500.
Uncut sheet
You can really appreciate the collection of images and the color scheme for each suit on the Cartomancer Poker Deck’s uncut sheet.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I have spent many months working on every detail of this project to ensure that the production and shipping will be efficient and without issues. It's mainly for that reason that I have chosen not to include add-on items that could slow down the production of the deck itself.

The cards are designed and ready for production as soon as funded. If you have any questions at all, feel free to contact me. Thank you and I hope you enjoy the cards as much as I enjoyed creating them.

Alain

Hi Kosmonauts! Last year we brought the KOSMOS Pen to life with your help. By now we shipped over 3000 pens around the world. Many of you have been waiting for a Titanium Version and after months of refinement we are finally able to present: the KOSMOS Titan.   
With your support we will be able to realize the production run of this ultimate Titanium Version of KOSMOS in two beautiful surface finishes. 
Just shift the Cap! - The magnetic forces inside KOSMOS are perfectly balanced. A strong Neodymium magnet holds the cap safely in the idle and writing position.
Fun to Play! - The simplest and most intuitive way to get a pen ready for writing: our new mechanism makes it possible.
Designed by Nature - The minimalistic design of KOSMOS is based on a universal pattern of nature: the Golden Ratio.
The best Material for a Lifetime Product - each part of KOSMOS is lathed from a solid block of highly durable Grade-5 Titanium.
The KOSMOS Titan is precision-machined out of solid Grade-5 Titanium. This remarkable material combines highest durability with exceptional light weight. We worked hard to achieve KOSMOS’ ultra-high tolerances with Titanium. The effort paid off: the magnetic mechanism works more smoothly than ever which gives the pen a unique feel of quality.
The Titan comes in two distinct finishes: a mirror polished version and a matt version.
The KOSMOS Titan comes in a redesigned matt-laminated premium packaging in all black.
The Mirror-Polished Version of Titan runs through multiple extensive polishing stages to make it shine like a mirror.
The Matt Version of Titan has a nice satin feel of the surface and is especially resistant against scratches.
The classic version of KOSMOS is precision-machined from solid Grade-6 Aluminium. It comes with a matt surface finish, which runs through a special anodisation process. This makes the pen very resistant against scratches and wear.
For this new Kickstarter campaign, we improved the functionality of the classic Aluminium KOSMOS entirely. This 2.0 version of our original pen is not available anywhere else yet. Same as the KOSMOS Titan it comes with refined tolerances and a even smoother mechanism.
You can choose from 3 reward tiers: the KOSMOS Titan in a single pack, the KOSMOS Titan in a 2-pack and the classic KOSMOS Aluminium. 
If you’d like to receive multiple rewards, simply add the respective amount to your pledge:
€89 KOSMOS Titan
€169 KOSMOS Titan 2-pack
€45 KOSMOS Aluminium
You will select the color you'd like to get in a Backerkit survey after the campaign.
The stilform Accessories will be available in the Backerkit Survey after the campaign.
To make your KOSMOS Pen truly the perfect everyday carry, we created a Leather Pouch that protects and holds it safely while you're on the go.
The Walnut Holder is the perfect place to keep your KOSMOS and present its design even better – wherever it may be: whether on your desk at work or at home in your living room.
   Specifications:
KOSMOS Titan Material: Grade-5 Titanium, Weight: 42
KOSMOS Classic Material: Grade-6 Aluminium, Weight: 26 g
Black Premium Cartridge with German Ink and Swiss Tungsten Tip included, Size M
Compatible with all G2 Standard Refills (Parker-Style Refills)
Gift Box Packaging
We have been working together with our trusted manufacturer for a long time. The production of the KOSMOS Titan is all set up and we have already produced a small batch of the polished version. In the process we gained valuable experience and resolved the production challenges of the Titanium material. So now we can make sure the production of all Kickstarter rewards runs as smoothly as possible.
To speed up the production process we arranged special condition with our manufacturer: We will order the raw material and start first lathing operations even before the campaign has ended. So you will receive your highly anticipated KOSMOS Titan as early as possible.
The final quality control of the pens will be done by ourselves personally. Afterwards a professional fulfillment partner will take care of the shipping of packages to your homes.
Sometimes the simplest things are the most profound. Attention to detail is of utmost importance when you want to look good.
Design and style should work toward making you look good and feel good without a lot of effort so you can get on with the things that matter. Follow us on our journey! - stilform
